text: We then have the WTI NYMEX oil, again it also shuts, the cash market shuts at 7.30, so from
the period of 7.30 till when the European cash markets open the next day, that would
be regarded as the overnight session, or the session where there is very little cash being
traded.
The cash or the initial balance session is not a hard, fast rule.
What's important to understand with the initial balance is the period in which it's very
unlikely to see bigger time frame participants or cash participants enter.
That period is known as the initial balance or the overnight session.
So with the oil, typically the overnight session would be from 10pm till 8am the
The EURUSDFX is, again, it opens at 10pm at night and again it will trade the overnight
session all the way until 8am the next morning.
Now note, predominantly with the foreign exchange markets, there is a dollar settlement
GMT every afternoon. So we could typically see the cash session being all the way from
8am to about 4pm and then the rest would be the overnight session or the initial balance.
Now again, remember what I said to you, the concept of the initial balance is not that
it creates hard fast rules, it's an understanding of when is there a time frame in which
participants initiative, you know, when is that time frame and when is the other time
frame where there's low volume, low liquidity and less likely opportunity to make money.
That is why we try and differentiate between the two time frames, but also because the
initial balance can give us some very, very early identifiers and opportunity heading
into the cash sessions.
